column1: Dilantin is a medicine used to prevent seizures.

The symptoms vary, but may include: - Coma - Confusion - Fever - Involuntary, jerky, repeated movement of the eyeballs (nystagmus) - Lethargy - Low blood pressure - Nausea - Sleepiness - Slow or slurred speech - Staggering gait or walk - Swollen gums - Tremor - Unsteadiness - Uncoordinated movements - Vomiting
